CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 15, 1959, pg. A1, reads: "Charge People From Other Areas Chief Cause of 3rd Ward's Filth and Stench - Sanitary Problems - Irresponsibility on the part of some residents of the Third Ward and outside visitors, the city refuse department and city health inspectors have allowed unsanitary conditions to arise in some areas of the Third Ward... The center photo shows one of the giant-sized mobile containers at the corner of Crawford St. and Wylie Ave., above the Civic Arena. This dumpster, jammed with garbage, much of it from visitors and not residents of the area, seemingly has been neglected by city refuse collectors... - Harris Photos."
TitMainTitle: Overflowing City of Pittsburgh garbage receptacle, in lot at intersection of Wylie Avenue and Crawford Street, Hill District
